item.title: Python and R
item.description: Python Communicating With R Here’s some ways that R and python can communicate. Variables defined in python can be displayed in a ggplot using R. import numpy as np x=np.random.normal(0,1,50) y=np.random.normal(0,1,50) library(reticulate) library(ggplot2) ggplot()+geom_point(aes(py$x,py$y)) + xlab("x") + ylab("y") + ggtitle("Random Scatterplot") Another Example Python and R can communicate with each other using Reticulate. Python can access R-defined objects using r. library(reticulate) place <- "Capetown," place="South Africa" print(r.place,place) ## Capetown, South Africa This can be done the other way as well.

item.title: Grammy Performance Song's Streams and Position
item.description: Introduction The dataset Streams contains the global and US streams by date for 3 Grammy performance songs: Watermelon Sugar-Harry Styles, Everything I Wanted-Billie Eilish, Don’t Start Now-Dua Lipa. This dataset was acquired from a website that contains Spotify streaming data on top songs (https://kworb.net/spotify/). This interested me, because I was curious to see how the number of streams compared since each was performed at the 2021 Grammy’s.

item.title: Hurricanes
item.description: Data The dataset I chose includes information on named hurricanes in the Atlantic Ocean. I found this dataset interesting becuase it comes from a paper that claimed that hurricanes with female names were not taken as seriously and therefore caused more deaths and damage. The main variables include: Name, wind speed in MPH, atmospheric pressure at landfall in millibars, date of first landfall, property damage in millions of 2014 US dollars, deaths, and whether the hurricane had a male or female name.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Check out some of my coding projects below: Wrangling & Exploratory Data Analysis: Preliminary data analysis of the streams and positions of three songs performed at the 2021 GRAMMY Awards show Modeling, Inference, Prediction: Modeling and prediction of the damage costs of named hurricanes in the Atlantic from 1950 to 2012 --
